snippet: Criticism from death penalty opponents and others increased as officials scrambled to determine why the execution by lethal injection did not go as planned.
abstract: Criticism swells from death penalty opponents and others as officials in Oklahoma scramble to determine why execution of Clayton D Lockett by lethal injection did not go as planned; Gov Mary Fallin defends death penalty but orders thorough review of state's procedure for lethal injections; says execution of second condemned inmate Charles F Warner will be delayed.

byline.original: By ERIK ECKHOLM and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Erik Eckholm reported from McAlester, Okla., and John Schwartz from New York. Motoko Rich contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Criticism from death penalty opponents and others increased as officials scrambled to determine why the execution by lethal injection did not go as planned.

headline.main: Oklahoma Vows Review of Botched Execution
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Vows Review in Botched Execution
